note.p: Birth: Branziet in the parish of Callander, Perthshire (15 February 1762)

Career: Surgeon, Bengal Establishment, HEIC; made botanical excursions; asked to report on countries of Mysore, Canaria and Malabar (1800); work published (1807); accompanied Lord Wellesley on return voyage (1806); made statistical survey of Presidency of Bengal (took 7 years); Superintendent, Botanical Garden, Calcutta (1914); returned to England (1815) then settled on his mother's estate in Scotland
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
